alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 9:27AM CDT until May 31 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, flood waters impact low lying areas west of Schell City. County roads west and north of Route M become flooded. The Four River Conservation Area 10 miles west of Schell City floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:46 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 31.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:46 AM CDT Sunday was 31.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 20.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.2 feet on 06/04/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 930 AM CDT.
